intro: Echium ecklonianum, commonly known as the Cape fuchsia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to purple, often with a distinctive blue or violet throat. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are woody and somewhat branched. Echium ecklonianum thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
